snippet: A debate over whether to reappoint the budget director raises a larger question about resistance to good news.
abstract: David Leonhardt The Upshot; debate in Congress over whether to reappoint Douglas Elmendorf as head of Congressional Budget Office underscores nation's resistance to good economic news; central plank of anti-Elmendorf case is notion that his budget office underestimated health care costs when evaluating health care reform law, when in fact the office overestimated medical costs.
lead_paragraph: A debate over whether to reappoint the budget director raises a larger question about resistance to good news.

headline.main: The Battle Over Douglas Elmendorf — and the Inability to See Good News
headline.print_headline: A Puzzling Resistance to Good Economic News

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
